operations.reasoning: Andy is working on productionizing the front end of the PR review pipeline - handling triggers and PR events that kick off the review process. Creating new issue.

createData.title: Productionize PR review pipeline (front): run PR review system on triggers
createData.description:
Productionize the front end of the PR review pipeline.

- Handle PR events and triggers that kick off the review process
- Wire up event listeners for new PRs
- Coordinate with Dave who is handling the back end (posting/reactions)

operations.reasoning: Dave is working on productionizing the back end of the PR review pipeline - handling posting comments to GitHub, reactions, and storing feedback. Creating new issue.

createData.title: Productionize PR review pipeline (back): posting comments, reactions, storing feedback
createData.description:
Productionize the back end of the PR review pipeline.

- Handle posting review comments to GitHub
- Implement reaction handling (upvotes, downvotes)
- Store feedback for analysis
- Coordinate with Andy who is handling the front end (triggers)

operations.reasoning: Chandler continues working on alert cleanup with new target of near-zero noise by end of week. Updating existing alert task with target milestone.

updateData.description:
Reduce non-actionable alert spam in the alerts channel to improve on-call signal quality.

- Identify and tune/suppress rules generating noise
- Treat as on-call hygiene task (~1-2 hours)
- Preserve critical alerts; do not silence actionable incidents
- Document changes and before/after examples

**Progress update (Dec 2):**
- HubSpot spam 99% resolved
- New focus: fix remaining error-group noise

**Progress update (Dec 3):**
- Target: near-zero noise by end of week
- Continuing to work down alert channel issues

linearState.title: Ship tenant-pruning cron to staging with logging and dry run
linearState.description:
Ship the tenant-pruning cron job to staging and merge today.

- Add logging to capture actions
- Run in dry-run mode for a couple of days to observe output
- Already tested via CLI
- Target staging first, then proceed based on dry-run results

linearState.title: Scrub noisy alerts in Slack to restore actionable signal
linearState.description:
Reduce non-actionable alert spam in the alerts channel to improve on-call signal quality.

- Identify and tune/suppress rules generating noise
- Treat as on-call hygiene task (~1-2 hours)
- Preserve critical alerts; do not silence actionable incidents
- Document changes and before/after examples

**Progress update (Dec 2):**
- HubSpot spam 99% resolved
- New focus: fix remaining error-group noise
- Actively creating and triaging issues for residual errors

linearState.title: Add label to distinguish TriageBot vs ambient extraction tickets
linearState.description:
Add a label or marker to distinguish TriageBot-created tickets from ambient extraction tickets.

- Helps reduce unnecessary Cursor cloud spend by filtering automation
- Allows skipping TriageBot issues from certain workflows
- Clear source identification for debugging and analytics

linearState.title: Delete legacy per-connector installation tables via migration script
linearState.description:
Write migration to drop legacy per-connector installation tables after confirming all data migrated to new polymorphic table.

- Verify all installations migrated to connector_installations table
- Drop legacy tables: Slack, GitHub, Linear, HubSpot, Trello installations
- Coordinate with Chandler to confirm no dependencies remain
- Test migration in staging before production

linearState.title: Implement automated runners for many-stage pipeline
linearState.description:
Jordan and Brent are building automated runners for the many-stage pipeline.

- Use browser-based tools for execution
- Enable the pipeline to run automatically end-to-end
- Support the create→assign→iterate→verify flow
